name: 3D Studio
professor: Andrew F. Scott and Roxanne Minnish
school: Harry W. Bass Jr. School of Arts, Humanities, and Technology
description: Focuses on creative research in 3D fabrication, digital design, and interdisciplinary art, supporting sculpture, digital modeling, and emerging technologies.

name: Anechoic Chamber and Transmedia Studio
school: Harry W. Bass Jr. School of Arts, Humanities, and Technology
description: A specialized facility for sound research, immersive audio, and experimental media, offering resources for transmedia storytelling and acoustic innovation.

name: ArtSciLab
school: Harry W. Bass Jr. School of Arts, Humanities, and Technology
description: An interdisciplinary lab where artists and scientists collaborate on projects bridging art, science, and technology, emphasizing research, creative production, and public engagement.

name: CG Animation Lab
school: Harry W. Bass Jr. School of Arts, Humanities, and Technology
description: Dedicated to computer graphics, animation, and interactive media, supporting student projects and research in digital animation and game development.

name: Critical Media Studies Lab
school: Harry W. Bass Jr. School of Arts, Humanities, and Technology
description: Examines the social, cultural, and political impact of media technologies through projects analyzing digital culture, media theory, and critical practice.

name: experimenta.l.
school: Harry W. Bass Jr. School of Arts, Humanities, and Technology
description: Explores experimental animation, visual storytelling, and innovative media forms, fostering research and artistic experimentation in moving images.

name: Game Lab
school: Harry W. Bass Jr. School of Arts, Humanities, and Technology
description: A collaborative space for designing, developing, and researching games, focusing on interactive entertainment, game design, and digital storytelling.

name: Games Research Lab
school: Harry W. Bass Jr. School of Arts, Humanities, and Technology
description: Dedicated to the study and creation of games, examining game mechanics, player experience, and the cultural significance of games in society.

name: LabSynthE
school: Harry W. Bass Jr. School of Arts, Humanities, and Technology
description: An experimental lab for electronic literature, sound art, and interdisciplinary digital projects, integrating creative writing, audio, and interactive media.

name: Mograph Lab
school: Harry W. Bass Jr. School of Arts, Humanities, and Technology
description: Specializes in motion graphics, animation, and visual effects for digital media and storytelling.

name: Motion Capture Lab
school: Harry W. Bass Jr. School of Arts, Humanities, and Technology
description: Equipped for motion capture research and production, supporting animation, biomechanics, and interactive media projects.

name: Narrative Systems Research Lab
school: Harry W. Bass Jr. School of Arts, Humanities, and Technology
description: Focuses on interactive storytelling, narrative design, and the study of narrative systems in games and digital media.

name: Public Interactives Research Lab (PIRL)
professor: Anne Balsamo and Heidi Rae Cooley
school: Harry W. Bass Jr. School of Arts, Humanities, and Technology
description: Investigates public interactives, digital installations, and participatory media, with projects engaging communities and public spaces.

name: The Studio for Mediating Play
professor: Dr. Josef Nguyen and Dr. Hong-An Wu
school: Harry W. Bass Jr. School of Arts, Humanities, and Technology
description: Researches play, games, and interactive media, examining how play mediates social, cultural, and technological experiences.

name: Abdi Personal Website
school: School of Behavioral and Brain Sciences
description: Personal academic website featuring research, publications, and resources in cognitive psychology and statistics.

name: Action, Cognition & Translational Neuroscience Lab
school: School of Behavioral and Brain Sciences
description: Researches the neural and cognitive mechanisms underlying action, cognition, and their translation to clinical populations.

name: Aging & Memory Research Laboratory
school: School of Behavioral and Brain Sciences
description: Studies the effects of aging on memory and cognition, with a focus on neurobiological and behavioral processes.

name: Aging Well Lab
school: School of Behavioral and Brain Sciences
description: Explores psychological and behavioral factors promoting healthy aging and well-being in older adults.

name: Axon Biology and Neuroinformatics Lab
school: School of Behavioral and Brain Sciences
description: Investigates axon biology, neural connectivity, and neuroinformatics using experimental and computational approaches.

name: CARE Lab
school: School of Behavioral and Brain Sciences
description: Focuses on clinical assessment, research, and education in neuropsychology and behavioral health.

name: Cellular and Synaptic Physiology Lab
school: School of Behavioral and Brain Sciences
description: Studies the physiology of neurons and synapses, focusing on mechanisms underlying learning, memory, and psychiatric disorders.

name: Child Language and Cognitive Processes Laboratory
school: School of Behavioral and Brain Sciences
description: Researches language development and cognitive processes in children, including typical and atypical populations.

name: Children and Families Lab
school: School of Behavioral and Brain Sciences
description: Examines child development within the context of family relationships and environmental factors.

name: Cognitive & Computational Neuroscience (CoCo-Neuro) Lab
school: School of Behavioral and Brain Sciences
description: Combines cognitive neuroscience and computational modeling to study brain function and behavior.

name: Cognitive Informatics and Statistics Lab
school: School of Behavioral and Brain Sciences
description: Focuses on cognitive informatics, statistical modeling, and computational approaches to understanding cognition.

name: Cognitive Neuroscience of Aging Lab
school: School of Behavioral and Brain Sciences
description: Studies brain aging, cognitive decline, and factors influencing healthy brain function in older adults.

name: Cognitive Neuroscience Laboratory of Memory and Language
school: School of Behavioral and Brain Sciences
description: Researches the neural basis of memory and language using neuroimaging and behavioral methods.

name: COMPASS of Psychopathology Lab
school: School of Behavioral and Brain Sciences
description: Investigates the classification and assessment of psychopathology using clinical and research approaches.

name: Computational Neuropsychology & Affective Neuroscience Lab
school: School of Behavioral and Brain Sciences
description: Studies neuropsychological and affective processes using computational and experimental techniques.

name: Cortical Plasticity Laboratory
school: School of Behavioral and Brain Sciences
description: Explores mechanisms of cortical plasticity and neural adaptation in health and disease.

name: D’Mello Lab
school: School of Behavioral and Brain Sciences
description: Researches brain development, neurodiversity, and cognitive neuroscience using neuroimaging and behavioral methods.

name: Developmental Affective, Motor, Memory, & Imaging (DAMMI) Lab
school: School of Behavioral and Brain Sciences
description: Studies affective, motor, and memory development using neuroimaging and behavioral approaches.

name: Developmental and Maternal Neurobiology Lab
school: School of Behavioral and Brain Sciences
description: Examines neurobiological mechanisms of maternal behavior and development.

name: Developmental Neurolinguistics Laboratory
school: School of Behavioral and Brain Sciences
description: Researches language development and neurolinguistics in children using behavioral and neuroimaging methods.

name: Developmental Social Affective Neuroscience Lab
school: School of Behavioral and Brain Sciences
description: Studies the development of social and affective processes in the brain across the lifespan.

name: Eagle Neuro Lab
school: School of Behavioral and Brain Sciences
description: Investigates neural circuits and behavior using experimental neuroscience techniques.

name: Engineer Lab
school: School of Behavioral and Brain Sciences
description: Focuses on neural engineering, auditory neuroscience, and brain-computer interfaces.

name: Face Perception Research Lab
school: School of Behavioral and Brain Sciences
description: Studies face perception, recognition, and computational modeling of facial processing.

name: Family Research Lab
school: School of Behavioral and Brain Sciences
description: Examines family dynamics, parenting, and child development through research and community engagement.

name: fNIM Laboratory
school: School of Behavioral and Brain Sciences
description: Uses functional neuroimaging to study memory, cognition, and brain function.

name: Gut, Brain, Pain Lab
school: School of Behavioral and Brain Sciences
description: Researches interactions between the gut, brain, and pain systems in health and disease.

name: Healthy Development Project
school: School of Behavioral and Brain Sciences
description: Focuses on promoting healthy development in children and adolescents.

name: Hearing Health Lab
school: School of Behavioral and Brain Sciences
description: Studies hearing health, auditory processing, and interventions for hearing loss.

name: Infant Learning Project
school: School of Behavioral and Brain Sciences
description: Investigates how infants learn about language, sound, and their environment.

name: Integrative Laryngeal BioPhysiology Lab
school: School of Behavioral and Brain Sciences
description: Studies the physiology and biomechanics of the larynx and voice disorders.

name: Kennedy Neuroimaging of Aging and Cognition (KNAC) Lab
school: School of Behavioral and Brain Sciences
description: Uses neuroimaging to study aging, cognition, and brain health.

name: Laboratory for Healthy Social-Emotional Development
school: School of Behavioral and Brain Sciences
description: Researches social-emotional development and well-being in children and adolescents.

name: Language Interaction and Language Acquisition in Children (LILAC) Lab
school: School of Behavioral and Brain Sciences
description: Studies language acquisition and interaction in children, focusing on bilingualism and language development.

name: Lifespan Neuroscience and Cognition (LiNC) Laboratory
school: School of Behavioral and Brain Sciences
description: Examines cognitive and brain changes across the lifespan using behavioral and neuroimaging methods.

name: Motivational, Affective, and Cognitive Systems
school: School of Behavioral and Brain Sciences
description: Studies motivation, affect, and cognitive systems in the brain using experimental and computational approaches.

name: Motor and Habit Learning Lab
school: School of Behavioral and Brain Sciences
description: Researches the neural basis of motor skills and habit learning.

name: Neuroaudiology Lab
school: School of Behavioral and Brain Sciences
description: Studies the neural mechanisms of hearing and auditory processing.

name: Neurobiology of Basal Ganglia Function and Dysfunction
school: School of Behavioral and Brain Sciences
description: Investigates the function and dysfunction of basal ganglia circuits in health and disease.

name: Neurobiology of Memory Lab
school: School of Behavioral and Brain Sciences
description: Explores the neurobiological mechanisms underlying memory formation and retention.

name: Neurodevelopmental Disorders and Epilepsy Lab
school: School of Behavioral and Brain Sciences
description: Focuses on neurodevelopmental disorders and epilepsy, using clinical and basic science approaches.

name: Neuroimaging of Reward Dynamics Lab (NiRD)
school: School of Behavioral and Brain Sciences
description: Uses neuroimaging to study reward processing and addiction in the human brain.

name: Neuroimmunology and Behavior Lab
school: School of Behavioral and Brain Sciences
description: Researches interactions between the immune system and behavior, focusing on pain and neuroinflammation.

name: NeuroPsychometric Research (NPR) Laboratory
school: School of Behavioral and Brain Sciences
description: Studies cognitive and neuropsychometric assessment, brain function, and aging.

name: NOISE Lab
school: School of Behavioral and Brain Sciences
description: Focuses on hearing loss, noise exposure, and auditory health research.

name: Pain Neurobiology Research Group
professor: Dr. Greg Dussor and Dr. Ted Price
school: School of Behavioral and Brain Sciences
description: Investigates the neurobiology of pain and the development of new pain therapies.

name: Pain Stress Lab
school: School of Behavioral and Brain Sciences
description: Studies the relationship between pain, stress, and brain function.

name: Park Aging Mind Laboratory
school: School of Behavioral and Brain Sciences
description: Researches cognitive aging, memory, and brain health in older adults.

name: Reasoning Lab
school: School of Behavioral and Brain Sciences
description: Explores the neural and cognitive mechanisms underlying reasoning and decision-making.

name: SLAM Lab
school: School of Behavioral and Brain Sciences
description: Researches speech, language, and music cognition using behavioral and neuroimaging methods.

name: Social Cognition and Interaction in Autism Lab
school: School of Behavioral and Brain Sciences
description: Studies social cognition and interaction in individuals with autism spectrum disorders.

name: Social Communication Lab
school: School of Behavioral and Brain Sciences
description: Focuses on social communication development and intervention in children with autism.

name: Social Psychology Research on INtercultural Groups Lab (SPRING Lab)
school: School of Behavioral and Brain Sciences
description: Researches social psychology, intercultural interactions, and group dynamics.

name: Solodkin/Small Brain Circuits Laboratory
professor: Dr. Ana Solodkin and Dr. Steven Small
school: School of Behavioral and Brain Sciences
description: Explores brain circuits underlying movement, cognition, and neurological disorders.

name: Speech Neuroscience Lab
school: School of Behavioral and Brain Sciences
description: Studies the neural mechanisms of speech production and perception.

name: Texas Pain Research Consortium
professor: Drs. Greg Dussor, Ted Price, Michael Burton, Bendict Kolber and Katelyn Sadler
school: School of Behavioral and Brain Sciences
description: A collaborative research group dedicated to advancing the understanding and treatment of pain. They bring together researchers from various disciplines to investigate the mechanisms underlying chronic pain conditions and develop novel therapeutic strategies.

name: The CHildren & Infant Listening Laboratory (CHILL)
school: School of Behavioral and Brain Sciences
description: Examines auditory development in infants and children, focusing on how hearing loss and early intervention impact speech and language acquisition. The lab uses behavioral and electrophysiological measures to assess auditory processing skills.

name: The Close Relationships and Health Lab
school: School of Behavioral and Brain Sciences
description: Investigates the interplay between close relationships and health outcomes, with a focus on how relationship dynamics, stress, and social support influence physical and mental well-being. Research methods include surveys, physiological measures, and observational studies.

name: The Personality And Interpersonal Relationships (Pair) Laboratory
school: School of Behavioral and Brain Sciences
description: Studies the connections between personality traits and interpersonal relationships, exploring topics such as attachment styles, relationship satisfaction, and the role of personality in social interactions. The lab employs a variety of research methods, including self-report questionnaires and behavioral experiments.

name: The Schizophrenia and Social Cognition Lab
school: School of Behavioral and Brain Sciences
description: Focuses on understanding social cognition deficits in individuals with schizophrenia, examining how these deficits impact social functioning and daily life. The lab uses neuropsychological assessments, eye-tracking technology, and social skills training interventions.

name: Think Lab
school: School of Behavioral and Brain Sciences
description: Examines how children and adults learn and reason about the world, with a focus on the development of critical thinking skills, belief formation, and understanding of complex concepts. The lab uses experimental methods to investigate cognitive processes and learning strategies.

name: Translational Auditory Perception (TAP) Lab
school: School of Behavioral and Brain Sciences
description: Studies auditory perception and its clinical applications, focusing on developing and evaluating interventions for individuals with hearing loss and other auditory disorders. The lab uses a combination of behavioral, electrophysiological, and computational methods.

name: VNS Stroke Trial
school: School of Behavioral and Brain Sciences
description: Investigates the use of vagus nerve stimulation (VNS) as a therapy to improve motor function in stroke survivors. The trial assesses the safety and efficacy of VNS paired with rehabilitation exercises to promote neural plasticity and functional recovery.

name: Wig Neuroimaging Lab
school: School of Behavioral and Brain Sciences
description: Uses neuroimaging techniques, such as fMRI, to study the neural basis of cognition and behavior, with a focus on understanding the brain's default mode network and its role in self-referential thought, memory, and social cognition.

name: Algorithms and Theory Group
professor: Dr. Sergey Bereg, Dr. Ovidiu Daescu, Dr. Kyle Fox, and Dr. Benjamin Raichel
school: Erik Jonsson School of Engineering and Computer Science
description: Conducts theoretical research in algorithms and data structures, with a focus on developing efficient solutions to fundamental problems in computer science. Areas of interest include computational geometry, graph algorithms, and approximation algorithms.

name: Applied Research for Mobility Systems Lab
school: Erik Jonsson School of Engineering and Computer Science
description: Focuses on applied research in mobility systems, including areas such as robotics, autonomous vehicles, and intelligent transportation systems. The lab develops algorithms and technologies for perception, navigation, and control of mobile robots and vehicles.

name: Comprehensive Advanced Manufacturing Lab
school: Erik Jonsson School of Engineering and Computer Science
description: Dedicated to advanced manufacturing research, focusing on innovative technologies and processes for creating high-quality products efficiently and sustainably. Research areas include additive manufacturing, smart manufacturing, and advanced materials processing.

name: Computational Fluid Dynamics (CFD) Laboratory
school: Erik Jonsson School of Engineering and Computer Science
description: Employs computational techniques to study fluid flow and heat transfer phenomena, with applications in areas such as aerospace engineering, energy systems, and environmental science. The lab uses high-performance computing to simulate complex fluid flows and optimize engineering designs.

name: Computational Research in Advanced Manufacturing
school: Erik Jonsson School of Engineering and Computer Science
description: Focuses on computational modeling and simulation of manufacturing processes, with the goal of improving efficiency, quality, and sustainability. Research areas include process optimization, materials design, and predictive maintenance.

name: Control, Optimization, and Networks Lab (CONLab)
school: Erik Jonsson School of Engineering and Computer Science
description: Conducts research in control theory, optimization, and network science, with applications in areas such as robotics, power systems, and social networks. The lab develops algorithms and tools for designing and controlling complex systems.

name: Dai Lab
school: Erik Jonsson School of Engineering and Computer Science
description: Focuses on micro- and nano-scale devices and systems, with applications in areas such as sensing, energy harvesting, and biomedical engineering. The lab develops novel materials, devices, and fabrication techniques for creating high-performance micro- and nano-systems.

name: Energy Storage Systems Lab
school: Erik Jonsson School of Engineering and Computer Science
description: Dedicated to energy storage research, focusing on developing advanced battery technologies and energy management systems. The lab conducts research on battery materials, cell design, and control algorithms for improving battery performance and lifespan.

name: Energy Systems Control Laboratory
school: Erik Jonsson School of Engineering and Computer Science
description: Focuses on the control and optimization of energy systems, with applications in areas such as power grids, renewable energy, and smart buildings. The lab develops algorithms and tools for improving the efficiency, reliability, and sustainability of energy systems.

name: Fluids, Turbulence Control & Renewable Energy Lab
school: Erik Jonsson School of Engineering and Computer Science
description: Conducts research in fluid mechanics, turbulence control, and renewable energy, with a focus on developing innovative solutions for improving energy efficiency and reducing environmental impact. The lab uses experimental and computational methods to study fluid flows and optimize energy systems.

name: Griffith Lab
school: Erik Jonsson School of Engineering and Computer Science
description: Focuses on the design and control of robotic systems, with applications in areas such as manufacturing, healthcare, and exploration. The lab develops algorithms and hardware for creating robots that can perform complex tasks in unstructured environments.

name: In-Fusion
school: Erik Jonsson School of Engineering and Computer Science
description: Focuses on research in the field of human-computer interaction, exploring new ways to seamlessly integrate technology into everyday life. The lab investigates topics such as augmented reality, wearable computing, and personalized interfaces to enhance user experience and productivity.

name: Intelligent Robotics and Vision Lab
school: Erik Jonsson School of Engineering and Computer Science
description: Focuses on research in computer vision and robotics, developing algorithms and systems for enabling robots to perceive and interact with the world. Areas of interest include object recognition, scene understanding, and robot navigation.

name: Image-Guided Drug Delivery Lab
school: Erik Jonsson School of Engineering and Computer Science
description: Focuses on developing novel techniques for targeted drug delivery using ultrasound imaging. The lab investigates methods for enhancing drug penetration, controlling drug release, and monitoring treatment response in real-time.

name: Lab of Developmental Systems Biology
school: Erik Jonsson School of Engineering and Computer Science
description: Dedicated to understanding the fundamental principles of developmental biology using systems-level approaches. The lab investigates how genes, molecules, and cells interact to orchestrate the development of complex organisms.

name: Mechanics of Advanced Materials Laboratory (MAML)
school: Erik Jonsson School of Engineering and Computer Science
description: Focuses on the mechanical behavior of advanced materials, including composites, nanomaterials, and biomaterials. The lab uses experimental and computational methods to characterize material properties, predict material performance, and design new materials for engineering applications.

name: Michael Zhang Computational Biology Laboratory
school: Erik Jonsson School of Engineering and Computer Science
description: Focuses on developing computational methods for analyzing biological data, with applications in genomics, proteomics, and systems biology. The lab investigates topics such as gene regulation, protein structure prediction, and disease modeling.

name: Micro/Nano Devices and Systems Lab (MiNDS)
school: Erik Jonsson School of Engineering and Computer Science
description: Dedicated to the design, fabrication, and characterization of micro- and nano-scale devices and systems. The lab investigates applications in areas such as sensing, energy harvesting, and biomedical engineering.

name: Multimedia Lab
school: Erik Jonsson School of Engineering and Computer Science
description: Focuses on research in multimedia computing, with a focus on developing new techniques for multimedia content analysis, retrieval, and communication. Areas of interest include image and video processing, multimedia databases, and multimedia networking.

name: Multiscale Simulation Lab
school: Erik Jonsson School of Engineering and Computer Science
description: Employs multiscale simulation techniques to study the behavior of materials and systems at different length and time scales. The lab investigates applications in areas such as materials design, nanotechnology, and biomechanics.

name: Nanomechanical Multiphysics Lab
school: Erik Jonsson School of Engineering and Computer Science
description: Focuses on the study of nanomechanical phenomena and their coupling with other physical phenomena, such as electricity, magnetism, and heat. The lab investigates applications in areas such as sensing, energy harvesting, and nanoelectronics.

name: Nanophotonics Lab
school: Erik Jonsson School of Engineering and Computer Science
description: Dedicated to the study of light-matter interactions at the nanoscale. The lab investigates applications in areas such as sensing, imaging, and energy harvesting.

name: Neural Interfaces Lab
school: Erik Jonsson School of Engineering and Computer Science
description: Focuses on developing neural interfaces for restoring lost function and treating neurological disorders. The lab investigates topics such as electrode design, biocompatibility, and neural signal processing.

name: Neuromuscular and Musculoskeletal Biomechanics Lab
school: Erik Jonsson School of Engineering and Computer Science
description: Studies the biomechanics of human movement, with a focus on understanding the interaction between the nervous system, muscles, and skeleton. The lab investigates applications in areas such as rehabilitation, sports performance, and injury prevention.

name: Neuronal Networks and Interfaces Laboratory
school: Erik Jonsson School of Engineering and Computer Science
description: Focuses on developing microscale devices to interface with neuronal networks. The lab engineers novel tools and techniques to study and manipulate neural activity for basic neuroscience research and neuroengineering applications.

name: Nosratinia Lab
school: Erik Jonsson School of Engineering and Computer Science
description: Focuses on information theory, wireless communication, and networking. This lab explores fundamental limits and practical designs for communication systems, with an emphasis on robustness, security, and efficiency.

name: Obaid Lab for Molecular Imaging and Optical
school: Erik Jonsson School of Engineering and Computer Science
description: Focuses on developing novel molecular imaging techniques for early disease detection and therapy monitoring. The lab combines expertise in chemistry, optics, and nanotechnology to create innovative imaging agents and devices.

name: Optical Communication Lab
school: Erik Jonsson School of Engineering and Computer Science
description: Focuses on advanced optical communication systems and networks. The lab researches new technologies for high-speed data transmission, including fiber optic communication, free-space optics, and underwater optical communication.

name: Physical Genomics Lab
school: Erik Jonsson School of Engineering and Computer Science
description: Focuses on understanding the physical organization of genomes and its impact on gene expression and regulation. The lab develops and applies novel experimental and computational techniques to study the 3D structure of DNA and its role in cellular processes.

name: Reliability and Design Automation Laboratory
school: Erik Jonsson School of Engineering and Computer Science
description: Focuses on ensuring the reliability and performance of electronic systems. The lab develops design automation tools and techniques to address challenges such as aging, variability, and security in modern integrated circuits.

name: Targeted Neuroplasicity Lab
school: Erik Jonsson School of Engineering and Computer Science
description: Focuses on understanding and manipulating neuroplasticity for therapeutic purposes. The lab investigates how targeted interventions, such as brain stimulation and pharmacological agents, can promote neural repair and functional recovery after injury or disease.

name: Ultrasound Imaging and Therapy Lab
school: Erik Jonsson School of Engineering and Computer Science
description: Focuses on developing advanced ultrasound techniques for medical imaging and therapy. The lab explores novel methods for enhancing image quality, delivering drugs, and ablating tumors using focused ultrasound.

name: Couples Daily Lives Lab
school: School of Interdisciplinary Studies
description: Examines the dynamics of romantic relationships in everyday life. The lab studies how couples interact, communicate, and cope with stress, with a focus on understanding the factors that contribute to relationship satisfaction and stability.

name: Ahn Lab
school: School of Natural Sciences and Mathematics
description: Focuses on the development of novel chemical tools and strategies for studying and manipulating biological systems. The lab's research spans chemical biology, organic chemistry, and medicinal chemistry.

name: Antimicrobial Peptide Signaling Lab
school: School of Natural Sciences and Mathematics
description: Studies the role of antimicrobial peptides in regulating immune responses and host-microbe interactions. The lab investigates how these peptides activate signaling pathways and modulate cellular functions to combat infection.

name: De Nisco Lab
school: School of Natural Sciences and Mathematics
description: Focuses on understanding the mechanisms of bacterial pathogenesis and antibiotic resistance. The lab investigates how bacteria evade the immune system and develop resistance to antibiotics, with the goal of identifying new therapeutic targets.

name: Dillon Lab
school: School of Natural Sciences and Mathematics
description: Focuses on understanding the molecular mechanisms that regulate genome organization and function. The lab uses biochemical, genetic, and genomic approaches to study how DNA is packaged and accessed in cells.

name: Dingal Lab
school: School of Natural Sciences and Mathematics
description: Focuses on synthetic organic chemistry, methodology development, and total synthesis of natural products. Research efforts are directed toward the design and implementation of innovative chemical transformations.

name: Dodani Lab
school: School of Natural Sciences and Mathematics
description: Focuses on developing and applying chemical tools to study biological processes. Research areas include drug delivery, molecular imaging, and protein engineering.

name: Exoplanet Group
school: School of Natural Sciences and Mathematics
description: Dedicated to the study of exoplanets, planets orbiting stars other than our Sun. The group uses observational data and theoretical models to characterize exoplanet properties, such as size, mass, and atmospheric composition.

name: Fasan Lab
school: School of Natural Sciences and Mathematics
description: Focuses on the design and engineering of peptides and proteins with novel functions. Research areas include biocatalysis, drug discovery, and biomaterials.

name: Gassensmith Lab
school: School of Natural Sciences and Mathematics
description: Focuses on the design, synthesis, and application of mechanically-interlocked molecules and polymers. Research efforts are directed toward creating new materials with unique properties and functions.

name: Gevorgyan Group
school: School of Natural Sciences and Mathematics
description: Focuses on the development of new catalytic reactions and their application to the synthesis of complex organic molecules. Research areas include organometallic chemistry, asymmetric catalysis, and total synthesis.

name: Hajeri Lab
school: School of Natural Sciences and Mathematics
description: Focuses on investigating the molecular mechanisms underlying plant development and stress responses. The lab uses genetic, genomic, and biochemical approaches to study plant hormone signaling, gene regulation, and environmental adaptation.

school: School of Natural Sciences and Mathematics
description: Develops advanced radar and imaging techniques for environmental monitoring, remote sensing, and security applications. The lab focuses on theoretical and experimental research in electromagnetics, signal processing, and image reconstruction.

name: Joshi Lab
school: School of Natural Sciences and Mathematics
description: Focuses on understanding the molecular mechanisms that regulate plant immunity and disease resistance. The lab uses genetic, genomic, and biochemical approaches to study plant-pathogen interactions and identify new strategies for crop protection.

name: Meteorite Education and Research Lab
school: School of Natural Sciences and Mathematics
description: Dedicated to the study of meteorites and other extraterrestrial materials. The lab provides educational resources and research opportunities for students and the public, promoting understanding of planetary science and the origins of the solar system.

name: Permian Basin Research Lab
school: School of Natural Sciences and Mathematics
description: Conducts research on the geology and geophysics of the Permian Basin, a major oil and gas producing region. The lab studies the formation, evolution, and resource potential of the basin, with a focus on improving energy exploration and production techniques.

name: Sherry Lab
school: School of Natural Sciences and Mathematics
description: Focuses on the development of contrast agents for magnetic resonance imaging (MRI). The lab designs and synthesizes new molecules that enhance the sensitivity and specificity of MRI, enabling improved diagnosis and monitoring of disease.

name: Smaldone Lab
school: School of Natural Sciences and Mathematics
description: Focuses on developing new methods for polymer synthesis and materials design. Research efforts are directed toward creating sustainable polymers with tailored properties for various applications.

name: Torabifard Lab
school: School of Natural Sciences and Mathematics
description: Focuses on experimental fluid mechanics and heat transfer, with applications in energy systems and environmental science. The lab uses advanced measurement techniques to study turbulent flows, convective heat transfer, and multiphase flows.

name: Zheng Lab
school: School of Natural Sciences and Mathematics
description: Focuses on nanomaterials and nanomedicine, with an emphasis on developing new diagnostic and therapeutic tools for cancer. The lab designs and synthesizes nanoparticles with tailored properties for targeted drug delivery, imaging, and therapy.

name: IQ Design
school: University-Wide Labs and Groups
description: Provides resources and support for students interested in innovation and design. The group offers workshops, mentorship, and prototyping facilities to help students develop and launch their own ventures.
